notesStmt.note: Stained. Stained. Slightly worm-eaten. Stained. Folio previously folded in 2. Previously folded.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian and Hebrew cursive of the 17th or 18th century. Italian semi-cursive script, partly punctuated, of the 15th century. Italian cursive script of the 16th century. Sefardi semi-cursive and square script of the 16th century. Sefardi (Oriental?) semi-cursive script of the 16th century. Italian cursive of the 18th century. Sefardi (Oriental?) semi-cursive script of the 17th century. Sefardi (Oriental?) semi-cursive script of the 16th to 17th century.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine title: 'Hebrew Fragments. Brit. Mus. Additional 27,212. 27,213.'

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), Italian bibliophile: 322 Hebrew manuscripts were acquired from his library in October 1865 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153): inscribed, [43v].
